Sequence Information.Source: screen from wild progenitor of bread wheat,Aegilops tauschii, plant-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (33.3%) toBrevinin-2DYeGRAVY: 0.16; M Wt: 5210.123; M formula: C232H357N59O63S6; mol ex coeff: 12902.5.Discovery:  inhibition of bacterial growth due to AMP gene expressionActivity: active against Gram+ B.subtilis IA274 (- insignificant), C. michiganensis (+++), B.cereus 905 (-), C. fangii (+++ very significant), B. subtilis 330-2 (+ significant),  B.subtilis RIK1285 (-), B.subtilis 168 (-), Gram- X. oryzae pv. Oryzae (+), X. oryzae pv. Oryzicola (+++), R. solanacearum (+), X. campestris pv. Holcicola (-). Bacteriostatic.Antimicrobial robustness: slight decrease in activity with the increase in temperature >60oCToxicity: human RBC (1%, incubation 1.5 h), 1.97% hemolysis at 1000 ug/ml (not hemo.lytic)Recombinant production:bacteria:Bacillus subtilis: the engineered liquid fermentation products were spray dried to power.Plant treatment:tomato: Its diluted solution of the fermented powder exerted an antimicrobial action by secreting antimicrobial protein.  had good inhibitory effects on tomato leaves and reduced fruit rot infected with fungus B. cinerea compared to the control (empty vector).
Literature Information.Author: Fu T, Islam MS, Ali M, Wu J, Dong W. 2020
Literature Information.Title: Two antimicrobial genes from Aegilops tauschii Cosson identified by the Bacillus subtilis expression system
